sect1.title: Who Should Read This Guide
sect1.para: This user guide is prepared for users of the neutron scattering instrument Wombat - High-Intensity Powder Diffractometer at the Bragg Institute, ANSTO. It can also be used as a reference by the instrument scientists of Wombat.

listitem.para: - Memory: at least 1GB of free physical memory
- Java SE JRE or JDK version 6 or above

sect2.title: Download and Install Gumtree-Wombat
sect2.para: Please find the newest version of Gumtree-Wombat at http://gumtree.codehaus.org/Downloads. The installer file name is WombatSetup_1.x.x.exe (here 'x' is the wildcard for version numbers). Please save the installer file in your local hard drive.
After downloading, please run the installer file. The installer pops up a window for you to specify an installation path.

The installation will put a short-cut file in the start menu and on the desktop. You can run Gumtree-Wombat by double clicking on the icon on your desktop, or from the start menu: Start -> Programs -> Gumtree -> Wombat 1.x.x.

sect2.title: Login to SICS
sect2.para: If your computer is in the NBI network, a window will pop up to ask you to login to SICS - the Instrument Control Sever, as shown in . Please ask the instrument scientists for the login information. If you do not want to login to SICS, simply tick the checkbox Do not ask to login again, and click on Cancel button.

sect2.title: Launch Application Windows
sect2.para: Gumtree-Wombat will display a welcome page after the start up. There are some quick launch short-cuts on the welcome page. Use Experiment Window button to launch the wombat experiment graphic user interface windows, which consist of experiment control, analysis and dashboard windows. The other chapters of this document will cover the functionality of the other buttons.

Welcome Screen
Alternatively, you can use the Launch button on the top left of the application window to drop down the similar menu. The Launch Menu

Once you clicking on the Experiment Window menu button, three application windows will automatically open. If you have three monitors, these application windows will the launch in to different monitors. You can identify these windows by the application titles, which are located at the top left corner of the windows. For example, , and .
To launch the dashboard window only, click on the Launch button. Then choose on the Instrument Dashboard button.
To launch the data analysis window only, click on the Launch button. Then choose Analysis Window option.
To launch the experiment window only, click on the Launch button. Choose Perspective option. Then choose Wombat Experiment option.

sect2.title: Select User Profile
sect2.para: Setup your user profile by using the User Profile Selector manu item.

A confirmation dialog window pops up. It warns you that if you have any experiment script unsaved or any analysis project opening, this action will clear them. If OK is selected in the confirmation dialog, a user profile dialog window pops up.
Follow these steps to change the user profile:

listitem.para: To setup a new user profile, type in the user name and use the Browse button to select a folder path. All data generated for this user will be copied to the specified folder.
To change the user profile, simply select an existing one from the profile list.
To apply the change, click on OK button.

sect2.para: Please note that unsaved script in the experiment window and existing analysis project in the analysis window will be removed.
